channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report E-2024100329
item.description:
Report E-2024100329

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4008
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver had completed his delivery but failed to completely drain the hose. As he disconnected the hose, approximately 2 gallons of diesel fuel was released. Patriot Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024100597
item.description:
Report X-2024100597

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GATX 226090 was spotted in the Arden Yard in Las Vegas, Nevada with product running down the side of the tank car during switching operations. Contractor responded and found two manway swing bolts less than tool tight and an estimated 5 gallons released. Contractor secured the tank car prior to the tank car continuing in transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024100301
item.description:
Report E-2024100301

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1144 ET, XPO-URE notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of battery acid released from a forklift battery due to improper loading. The release impacted inside trailer#311-2290, ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. 218765-1 30 gallon poly drum, pallet, oil dri, product and gloves. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100249
item.description:
Report E-2024100249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0355 ET, Sean Kelly with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSL (old). It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Isopropyl Alcohol 70% was released from 55-gallon metal drum, due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted Dock Door 73. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. 218731-1 – 96-gallon metal drum contains a 55-gallon metal drum of Isopropyl Alcohol 70% and oil dri. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100247
item.description:
Report E-2024100247

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:11ET, Seth Wallace with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal HRE. It was reported that approximately 10-gallons of PERACLEAN® 5 released from (2) 5-gallon jerrycans due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted inside of trailer #3212280. The contractors containerized product only in (1) 55-gallon vented poly drum, PPE, absorbents and pads were put into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.
